meanings.definition: The act of extending in time or duration.
meanings.sent1: The prolongations of the meeting made everyone tired.
meanings.sent2: The prolongations of the movie with extra scenes were enjoyable.
meanings.sent3: The prolongations of the game due to a sudden rain shower added an unexpected twist.
meanings.sent4: The prolongations of the deadline felt like a never-ending journey.
meanings.sent5: The prolongations of the music concert kept the audience engaged.

meanings.definition: Something that extends the length or duration of something else.
meanings.sent1: The new software is a prolongation of the old system.
meanings.sent2: The scarf acted as a prolongation of her outfit.
meanings.sent3: The extra toppings on the pizza were a delicious prolongation.
meanings.sent4: His apology was a prolongation of their conversation.
meanings.sent5: The bridge served as a vital prolongation for the commuters.
